Page.Title: Installing Sirens
Page.Description:
Sirens can come in several different formats. The steps to install them vary depending on what you've downloaded.
**What format is your siren mod in?**

Page.Title: Installing a .oac Siren Pack
Page.Description:
If your siren mod comes with a `.oac` file and a `vehicles` folder, follow these steps:
1. Open OpenIV and go to: `GTAV/mods/x64/audio/sfx/resident.rpf` 2. Make sure **Edit Mode** is enabled. 3. Drag and drop the `.oac` file into this folder. (It will rebuild `vehicles.awc` automatically.)
ðŸš¨ If prompted to overwrite, click **Yes**.

Page.Title: Installing a .awc Siren Pack
Page.Description:
If your siren mod comes with a precompiled `vehicles.awc` file:
1. Open OpenIV and go to: `GTAV/mods/x64/audio/sfx/resident.rpf` 2. Enable **Edit Mode**. 3. Drag and drop the `vehicles.awc` file into this folder.
ðŸ§ This method skips the `.oac` process but overwrites your existing sirens directly.

Page.Title: Installing .wav Siren Files
Page.Description:
If your siren mod comes with raw `.wav` files only:
1. Open OpenIV and go to: `GTAV/mods/x64/audio/sfx/resident.rpf` 2. Right-click `vehicles.awc` > **Export to OpenFormats** Export to an empty folder. 3. You will now see a `vehicles` folder and a `.oac` file. 4. Replace the `.wav` files inside the `vehicles` folder with the ones from your siren mod. 5. Drag the `.oac` file back into `resident.rpf` to rebuild the `.awc`.
